abstract.description:
The dataset consists of particle jets extracted from simulated proton-proton collision events at a center-of-mass energy of 13 TeV generated with Pythia 8. The particles emerging from the collisions traverse through a simulation of the CMS detector. The particles were reconstructed from the simulated detector signals using the particle-flow (PF) algorithm. The reconstructed particles are also called PF candidates. The jets in this dataset were clustered from the PF candidates of each collision event using the anti-$k_t$ algorithm with distance parameter $R = 0.4$. The standard L1+L2+L3+residual jet energy corrections are applied to the jets and pileup contamination is mitigated using the charged hadron subtraction (CHS) algorithm.

From each collision event, only those jets with transverse momentum exceeding 30 GeV were saved to file. The jets were also required to have pseudorapidity of less than 2.5 (this indicates the jet's position in the detector). For each jet, there are variables describing the jet on a high-level, particle-level and generator-level. There are also some variables describing the collision event and the conditions of its simulation. All of the variables are saved on a jet-by-jet basis, which means that one row of data corresponds to one jet.

The origin of a jet is particularly interesting. This so-called flavor of the jet is obtained from the generator-level particles by a jet flavor algorithm, which attempts to match a reconstructed jet to a single initiating particle. As a consequence, the jet flavor definition depends on the chosen algorithm. Here three different flavor definitions are available. The ‘hadron’ definition identifies b- and c-hadrons from the jet’s constituents, so it is only useful for b-tagging studies. The ‘parton’ definition extends this to include the light jet flavors (u, d, s and gluon). Finally there is the ‘physics’ definition, which looks at the quarks and gluons of the initial collision. The ‘parton’ and ‘physics’ definitions both identify all jet flavors, but the former is more biased towards b- and c-quarks. If in doubt, it is recommended to use the ‘physics’ definition.

dataset_semantics.description: Transverse momentum of the jet.
Pseudorapidity (η) of the jet.
Azimuthal angle (ϕ) of the jet.
Mass of the jet.
Girth of the jet (as defined in arXiv:1106.3076 [hep-ph]).
Catchment area of the jet; used for jet energy corrections.
Transverse momentum of the jet before the energy corrections.
Mass of the jet before the energy corrections.
Binary variable indicating whether the jet passes 'loose' criteria for being a real jet.
Binary variable indicating whether the jet passes 'tight' criteria for being a real jet.
1: if a matched generator level jet exists; 0: if no match was found.
Quark-Gluon jet likelihood discriminant variable built out of the three following variables (see the report CMS-PAS-JME-13-002 for more information).
Jet energy variable (see CMS-PAS-JME-13-002).
Minor axis of the jet (see CMS-PAS-JME-13-002).
Jet constituent multiplicity with additional cuts (see CMS-PAS-JME-13-002).
Flavour of the jet, as defined by the CMS parton-based definition.
Flavour of the jet, as defined by the CMS hadron-based definition.
Flavour of the jet, as defined by the CMS 'physics' definition (if in doubt, use this).
Indicates light quark (Up, Down, Strange) jets: partonFlav = 1, 2, 3.
Indicates gluon jets: partonFlav = 21.
Indicates any other kind of jet: partonflav != 1, 2, 3, 21.
Indicates light quark (Up, Down, Strange) jets: physFlav = 1, 2, 3.
Indicates gluon jets: physFlav = 21.
Indicates any other kind of jet: physFlav != 1, 2, 3, 21.
Multiplicity of charged hadron jet constituents.
Multiplicity of neutral hadron jet constituents.
Multiplicity of charged jet constituents.
Multiplicity of neutral jet constituents.
Multiplicity of jet constituents.
Number of particle flow (PF) candidates (particles reconstructed by the particle flow algorithm); contains all particles within |Δϕ| < 1 and |Δη| < 1 from the center of the jet.
Transverse momentum of a PF candidate.
Distance of a PF candidate to the center of the jet.
Polar angle (θ) of a PF candidate.
Azimuthal angle (ϕ) of a PF candidate.
Pseudorapidity (η) of a PF candidate.
Mass of a PF candidate.
Generator level particle identifier for the particle flow candidates, as defined in the PDG particle numbering scheme.
A number indicating how tightly a particle is associated with the primary vertex (ranges from 3 to 0).
1: if the particle flow candidate is a constituent of the reconstructed AK4 jet; 0: if it is not a constituent of the jet.
Transverse momentum of the matched generator level jet.
Pseudorapidity (η) of the matched generator level jet.
Azimuthal angle (ϕ) of the matched generator level jet.
Mass of the matched generator level jet.
Number of particles in the matched generator level jet.
Transverse momentum of a particle in the matched generator level jet.
Distance of a particle to the center of the matched generator level jet.
Polar angle (θ) of a particle in the matched generator level jet.
Mass of a particle in the matched generator level jet.
Generator level particle identifier for the particles in the matched generator level jet, as defined in the PDG particle numbering scheme.
Multiplicity of jets in the event.
Indicates the ranking number of the jet, as the jets are ordered by their transverse momenta within a single event.
The phi difference of the two leading jets.
The eta difference of the two leading jets.
If there are at least 3 jets in the event, alpha is the third jet's transverse momentum divided by the average transverse momentum of the two leading jets.
Event number.
Run number.
Luminosity block.
Transverse momentum of the generated hard process.
Weight assigned to the generated event.
The median density (in GeV/A) of pile-up contamination per event; computed from all PF candidates of the event.
Same as above, computed from all PF candidates with |η| < 2.5.
Same as above, computed from all neutral PF candidates with |η| < 2.5.
Same as above, computed from all PF charged hadrons associated to pileup vertices and with |η| < 2.5.
The number of good reconstructed primary vertices.
The number of pileup interactions that have been added to the event in the current bunch crossing.
The true mean number of the poisson distribution for this event from which the number of interactions in each bunch crossing has been sampled.

methodology.description: This dataset was produced with the software available in:

title: Sample with jet properties for jet-flavor and other jet-related ML studies JetNTuple_QCD_RunII_13TeV_MC

usage.description: The use of these files does not require any software specific to the CMS experiment. There are two sets of equivalent files in two different formats: ROOT and H5. An example notebook is provided.

abstract.description:
The dataset consists of particle jets extracted from simulated proton-proton collision events at a center-of-mass energy of 13 TeV generated with Pythia 8. It has been produced for developing machine-learning algorithms to differentiate jets originating from a Higgs boson decaying to a bottom quark-antiquark pair (Hbb) from quark or gluon jets originating from quantum chromodynamic (QCD) multijet production.

The reconstructed jets are clustered using the anti-kT algorithm with R=0.8 from particle flow (PF) candidates (AK8 jets). The standard L1+L2+L3+residual jet energy corrections are applied to the jets and pileup contamination is mitigated using the charged hadron subtraction (CHS) algorithm. Features of the AK8 jets with transverse momentum pT > 200 GeV and pseudorapidity |η| < 2.4 are provided. Selected features of inclusive (both charged and neutral) PF candidates with pT > 0.95 GeV associated to the AK8 jet are provided. Additional features of charged PF candidates (formed primarily by a charged particle track) with pT > 0.95 GeV associated to the AK8 jet are also provided. Finally, additional features of reconstructed secondary vertices (SVs) associated to the AK8 jet (within ∆R < 0.8) are also provided.

dataset_semantics.description: Event number
Number of reconstructed primary vertices (PVs)
True mean number of the poisson distribution for this event from which the number of interactions in each bunch crossing has been sampled
Median density (in GeV/A) of pile-up contamination per event; computed from all PF candidates of the event
Boolean that is 1 if the simulated sample corresponds to QCD multijet production
Double-b tagging discriminant based on a boosted decision tree calculated for the AK8 jet (see CMS-BTV-16-002)
Pseudorapidity η of the AK8 jet
Pseudorapidity η of the generator-level, matched heavy particle: H, W, Z, top, etc. (default = -999)
Transverse momentum of the generator-level, geometrically matched heavy particle: H, W, Z, t, etc. (default = -999)
Boolean that is 1 if two or more b hadrons are clustered within the AK8 jet (see SWGuideBTagMCTools)
Boolean that is 1 if fewer than two b hadrons are clustered within the AK8 jet (see SWGuideBTagMCTools)
Number of b hadrons that are clustered within the AK8 jet (see SWGuideBTagMCTools)
Number of c hadrons that are clustered within the AK8 jet (see SWGuideBTagMCTools)
Boolean that is 1 if a generator-level Higgs boson and its daughters are geometrically matched to the AK8 jet
Boolean that is 1 if a generator-level top quark and its daughters are geometrically matched to the AK8 jet
Boolean that is 1 if a generator-level W boson and its daughters are geometrically matched to the AK8 jet
Boolean that is 1 if a generator-level Z boson and its daughters are geometrically matched to the AK8 jet
Boolean that is 1 if none of the above matching criteria are satisfied (H, top, W, Z)

Integer label: `Invalid=0,  Top_all=10, Top_bcq=11, Top_bqq=12, Top_bc=13, Top_bq=14, W_all=20, W_cq=21, W_qq=22, Z_all=30, Z_bb=31, Z_cc=32, Z_qq=33, H_all=40, H_bb=41, H_cc=42, H_qqqq=43, QCD_all=50, QCD_bb=51, QCD_cc=52, QCD_b=53, QCD_c=54, QCD_others=55`
Alternative integer label from the CMS Jet/MET and Resolution (JMAR) group:  `Default=0, Top=1, W=2, Z=3, H=4`
Alternative (legacy) integer label: `Default=0, Top=1, W=2, Z=3, H=4`
Number of tracks associated with the AK8 jet
Number of SVs associated with the AK8 jet (∆R < 0.7)
Number of soft drop subjets in the AK8 jet (up to 2)
Ungroomed mass of the AK8 jet
Azimuthal angle ϕ of the AK8 jet
Transverse momentum of the AK8 jet
N-subjettiness variable for a 1-prong jet hypothesis
N-subjettiness variable for a 2-prong jet hypothesis
N-subjettiness variable for a 3-prong jet hypothesis
N-subjettiness variable for 2-prong vs 1-prong jet discrimination (`fj_tau2/fj_tau1`)
N-subjettiness variable for 3-prong vs 2-prong jet discrimination (`fj_tau3/fj_tau2`)
Soft drop mass of the AK8 jet
Transverse momentum times the ΔR between the two soft drop subjets
Absolute relative difference between the transverse momenta of the two softdrop subjets
Fraction of second subjet transverse momentum times ∆R squared
First axis of the first subjet
Second axis of the first subjet

Transverse momentum of the first subjet

ptD variable, defined as the square root of the sum in quadrature of the transverse momentum of the subjet constituents divided by the scalar sum of the transverse momentum of the subjet constituents, for the first subjet (see CMS-PAS-JME-13-002)
First axis of the first subjet
Second axis of the first subjet
Combined secondary vertex (CSV) b-tagging discriminant for the first subject
Pseudorapidity η of the second subjet

ptD variable, defined as the square root of the sum in quadrature of the transverse momentum of the subjet constituents divided by the scalar sum of the transverse momentum of the subjet constituents, for the second subjet (see CMS-PAS-JME-13-002)

Third largest track 3D signed impact parameter significance (see CMS-BTV-16-002)

First largest track 3D signed impact parameter significance associated to the second N-subjettiness axis
Second largest track 3D signed impact parameter significance associated to the second N-subjettiness axis
Track 2D signed impact parameter significance of the first track lifting the combined invariant mass of the tracks above the c hadron threshold mass (1.5 GeV)
Track 2D signed impact parameter significance of the first track lifting the combined invariant mass of the tracks above b hadron threshold mass (5.2 GeV)
Track 2D signed impact parameter significance of the second track lifting the combined invariant mass of the tracks above b hadron threshold mass (5.2 GeV)
Smallest track pseudorapidity ∆η, relative to the jet axis, associated to the first N-subjettiness axis
Second smallest track pseudorapidity ∆η, relative to the jet axis, associated to the first N-subjettiness axis
Third smallest track pseudorapidity ∆η, relative to the jet axis, associated to the first N-subjettiness axis
Smallest track pseudorapidity ∆η, relative to the jet axis, associated to the second N-subjettiness axis
Second smallest track pseudorapidity ∆η, relative to the jet axis, associated to the second N-subjettiness axis
Third smallest track pseudorapidity ∆η, relative to the jet axis, associated to the second N-subjettiness axis
Total SV mass for the first N-subjettiness axis, defined as the invariant mass of all tracks from SVs associated with the first N-subjettiness axis
Total SV mass for the second N-subjettiness axis, defined as the invariant mass of all tracks from SVs associated with the second N-subjettiness axis

SV vertex energy ratio for the first N-subjettiness axis, defined as the total energy of all SVs associated with the first N-subjettiness axis divided by the total energy of all the tracks associated with the AK8 jet that are consistent with the PV

SV energy ratio for the second N-subjettiness axis, defined as the total energy of all SVs associated with the first N-subjettiness axis divided by the total energy of all the tracks associated with the AK8 jet that are consistent with the PV
Transverse (2D) flight distance significance between the PV and the SV with the smallest uncertainty on the 3D flight distance associated to the first N-subjettiness axis
Transverse (2D) flight distance significance between the PV and the SV with the smallest uncertainty on the 3D flight distance associated to the second N-subjettiness axis
Pseudoangular distance ∆R between the first N-subjettiness axis and SV direction
Number of particle flow (PF) candidates associated to the AK8 jet with transverse momentum greater than 0.95 GeV
Number of particle flow (PF) candidates associated to the AK8 jet with transverse momentum greater than 0.95 GeV

PV association quality for the PF candiate: `UsedInFitTight=7`, the track is used in the PV fit and the weight is above 0.5; `UsedInFitLoose=6`,  the track is used in the PV fit and the weight is below 0.5; `CompatibilityDz=5` the track is not used in fit but is very close in `dz` to the PV (`dzsig` < 5 or `dz` < 300 um); `CompatibilityBTag=4`, the track is not compatible with the PV but it is close to the nearest jet axis starting from the PV (distance to jet axis < 700 um); `NotReconstructedPrimary=0`, the track is not associated to any PV and is compatible with the beam spot hence it is likely to be originating from an interaction for which we did not reconstruct the PV (beam spot compatibility: `dxysig` < 2 and `dxy` < 200 um); `OtherDeltaZ=1`, none of the above criteria is satisfied, hence the closest in `dz` vertex is associated)
Electric charge of the PF candidate
Pseudoangular distance ∆R between the PF candidate and the AK8 jet axis
Minimum pseudoangular distance ∆R between the associated SVs and the PF candidate
Pseudoangular distance ∆R between the PF candidate and the first soft drop subjet
Pseudoangular distance ∆R between the PF candidate and the second soft drop subjet
Transverse (2D) impact paramater of the PF candidate, defined as the distance of closest approach of the PF candidate trajectory to the beam line in the transverse plane to the beam
Transverse (2D) impact paramater significance of the PF candidate
Longitudinal impact parameter, defined as the distance of closest approach of the PF candidate trajectory to the PV projected on to the z direction
Longitudinal impact parameter significance of the PF candidate
Energy of the PF candidate divided by the energy of the AK8 jet
Pseudorapidity of the PF candidate relative to the AK8 jet axis
Azimuthal angular distance ∆ϕ between the PF candidate and the AK8 jet axis
Transverse momentum of the PF candidate divided by the transverse momentum of the AK8 jet

Integer indicating whether the PF candidate is consistent with the PV: `PVUsedInFit=3`, if the track is used in the PV fit; `PVTight=2` if the track is not used in the fit of any of the other PVs and is closest in z to the PV, `PVLoose=1` if the track is closest in z to a PV other then the PV; `NoPV=0` if the track is used in the fit of another PV
Fraction of energy of the PF candidate deposited in the hadron calorimeter
Boolean that is 1 if the PF candidate is classified as a charged hadron
Boolean that is 1 if the PF candidate is classified as an electron
Boolean that is 1 if the PF candidate is classified as an photon
Boolean that is 1 if the PF candidate is classified as an muon
Boolean that is 1 if the PF candidate is classified as a neutral hadron

Integer with information related to inner silicon tracker hits for the PF candidate: `validHitInFirstPixelBarrelLayer=-1`, if the track has a valid hit in the first pixel barrel layer; `noLostInnerHits=0` if it does not have such hit because of geometrical or detector inefficiencies (i.e. the hit wasn't expected to be there); `oneLostHit=1`, if the track extrapolation towards the beam line crosses an active detector but no hit is found there; `moreLostHits=2` if there are at least two missing expected inner hits
Mass of the PF candidate
Pileup per-particle identification (PUPPI) weight indicating whether the PF candidate is pileup-like (0) or not (1)
Number of tracks associated with the AK8 jet
Number of tracks associated with the AK8 jet
Pseudoangular distance ∆R between the track and the AK8 jet axis
Pseudorapidity η of the track
Pseudorapidity ∆η of the track relative the AK8 jet axis
Minimum track approach distance to the AK8 jet axis
Momentum of the track
Component of track momentum parallel to the AK8 jet axis
Component of track momentum parallel to the AK8 jet axis, normalized to the track momentum
Component of track momentum perpendicular to the AK8 jet axis, normalized to the track momentum
Component of track momentum perpendicular to the AK8 jet axis
Transverse (2D) signed impact paramater of the track
Transverse (2D) signed impact paramater significance of the track
3D signed impact parameter significance of the track
3D signed impact parameter of the track

PV association quality for the track: `UsedInFitTight=7`, the track is used in the PV fit and the weight is above 0.5; `UsedInFitLoose=6`, the track is used in the PV fit and the weight is below 0.5; `CompatibilityDz=5` the track is not used in fit but is very close in `dz` to the PV (`dzsig` < 5 or `dz` < 300 um); `CompatibilityBTag=4`, the track is not compatible with the PV but it is close to the nearest jet axis starting from the PV (distance to jet axis < 700 um); `NotReconstructedPrimary=0`, the track is not associated to any PV and is compatible with the BeamSpot hence it is likely to be originating from an interaction for which we did not reconstruct the PV (beam spot compatibility: `dxysig` < 2 and `dxy` < 200 um); `OtherDeltaZ=1`, none of the above criteria is satisfied, hence the closest in dZ vertex is associated)
Electric charge of the charged PF candidate
Pseudoangular distance (∆R) between the charged PF candidate and the AK8 jet axis
Track covariance matrix entry (eta, eta)
Track covariance matrix entry (lambda, dz)
Track covariance matrix entry (phi, phi)
Track covariance matrix entry (phi, xy)
Track covariance matrix entry (pT, pT)
Track covariance matrix entry (dxy, dxy)
Track covariance matrix entry (dxy, dz)
Track covariance matrix entry (dz, dz)
Minimum pseudoangular distance ∆R between the associated SVs and the charged PF candidate
Pseudoangular distance ∆R between the charged PF candidate and the first soft drop subjet
Pseudoangular distance ∆R between the charged PF candidate and the second soft drop subjet
Transverse (2D) impact parameter of the track, defined as the distance of closest approach of the track trajectory to the beam line in the transverse plane to the beam
Transverse (2D) impact parameter significance of the track
Longitudinal impact parameter, defined as the distance of closest approach of the track trajectory to the PV projected on to the z direction
Longitudinal impact parameter significance of the track
Energy of the charged PF candidate divided by the energy of the AK8 jet
Pseudorapidity ∆η of the track relative to the jet axis

Integer indicating whether the charged PF candidate is consistent with the PV: `PVUsedInFit=3`, if the track is used in the PV fit; `PVTight=2` if the track is not used in the fit of any of the other PVs and is closest in z to the PV, `PVLoose=1` if the track is closest in z to a PV other then the PV; `NoPV=0` if the track is used in the fit of another PV
Boolean that is 1 if the charged PF candidate is classified as a charged hadron
Boolean that is 1 if the charged PF candidate is classified as an electron
Boolean that is 1 if the charged PF candidate is classified as a muon

Integer with information related to inner silicon tracker hits for the track: `validHitInFirstPixelBarrelLayer=-1`, if the track has a valid hit in the first pixel barrel layer; `noLostInnerHits=0` if it does not have such hit because of geometrical or detector inefficiencies (i.e. the hit wasn't expected to be there); `oneLostHit=1`, if the track extrapolation towards the beam line crosses an active detector but no hit is found there; `moreLostHits=2` if there are at least two missing expected inner hits
Mass of the charged PF candidate
Normalized χ2 of the track fit
Azimuthal angular distance ∆ϕ between the charged PF candidate and the AK8 jet axis
Transverse momentum of the charged PF candidate
Transverse momentum of the charged PF candidate divided by the transverse momentum of the AK8 jet
Pileup per-particle identification (PUPPI) weight indicating whether the PF candidate is pileup-like (0) or not (1)

Track quality: `undefQuality=-1`; `loose=0`; `tight=1`; `highPurity=2`; `confirmed=3`, if track found by more than one iteration; `looseSetWithPV=5`; `highPuritySetWithPV=6`, `discarded=7` if a better track found; `qualitySize=8`
Number of secondary vertices (SV) associated with the AK8 jet (∆R < 0.8)
Number of secondary vertices (SV) associated with the AK8 jet (∆R < 0.8)
χ2 of the vertex fit
number of degrees of freedom of the vertex fit
χ2 divided by the number of degrees of freedom for the vertex fit
Cosine of the angle cos(θ) between the SV and the PV
3D flight distance of the SV
3D flight distance uncertainty of the SV
3D flight distance significance of the SV
Transverse (2D) flight distance of the SV
Transverse (2D) flight distance uncertainty of the SV
Transverse (2D) flight distance significance of the SV
Pseudoangular distance ∆R between the SV and the AK8 jet
Energy of the SV divided by the energy of the AK8 jet
Pseudorapidity ∆η of the SV relative to the AK8 jet axis
Mass of the SV
Number of tracks associated with the SV
Azimuthal angular distance ∆ϕ of the SV relative to the jet axis

methodology.description: This dataset was produced with the software available in:

title: Sample with jet, track and secondary vertex properties for Hbb tagging ML studies HiggsToBBNTuple_HiggsToBB_QCD_RunII_13TeV_MC

usage.description: The use of these files does not require any software specific to the CMS experiment. There are two sets of files in two different formats: ROOT and H5. For the H5 files, only information for up to 100 particle candidates, up to 60 charged particles or tracks, and up to 5 secondary vertices are stored in zero-padded arrays. An example notebook is provided.
